name: Repeaters, primary, female (% of female enrollment)
sourceNote: Repeaters in primary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Repeaters, primary, male (% of male enrollment)
sourceNote: Repeaters in primary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Repeaters, primary, total (% of total enrollment)
sourceNote: Repeaters in primary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Trained teachers in primary education, female (% of female teachers)
sourceNote: Trained teachers in primary education are the percentage of primary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in their country.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization, special data collection for the Education for All Initiative.

name: Trained teachers in primary education, male (% of male teachers)
sourceNote: Trained teachers in primary education are the percentage of primary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in their country.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization, special data collection for the Education for All Initiative.

name: Trained teachers in primary education (% of total teachers)
sourceNote: Trained teachers in primary education are the percentage of primary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in their country.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization, special data collection for the Education for All Initiative.

name: Primary education, teachers
sourceNote: Primary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Primary education, teachers (% female)
sourceNote: Female teachers as a percentage of total primary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Total enrollment, primary (% net)
sourceNote: Total enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Total enrollment, primary, female (% net)
sourceNote: Total enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Total enrollment, primary, male (% net)
sourceNote: Total enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Children out of school, primary
sourceNote: Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Children out of school, primary, female
sourceNote: Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Children out of school, primary, male
sourceNote: Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Secondary school starting age (years)
sourceNote: Secondary school starting age is the age at which students would enter secondary education, assuming they had started at the official entrance age for the lowest level of education, had studied full-time throughout and had progressed through the system without repeating or skipping a grade.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Secondary education, duration (years)
sourceNote: Secondary education, duration (years) is the number of grades (years) in secondary school.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Duration of education, lower secondary
sourceNote: Lower secondary duration refers to the number of years of full-time equivalent duration in lower secondary education in the school system according to ISCED.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Duration of education, upper secondary
sourceNote: Upper secondary duration refers to the number of years of full-time equivalent duration in upper secondary education in the school system according to ISCED.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Secondary education, pupils
sourceNote: Secondary education pupils is the total number of pupils enrolled at secondary level in public and private schools.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Student enrollment, secondary, female
sourceNote: Secondary education pupils is the total number of pupils enrolled at secondary level in public and private schools.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Vocational and Technical enrollment (% of total secondary enrollment), female
sourceNote: Vocational and Technical enrollment (% of total secondary enrollment) is the number of vocational and technical secondary level students (total, male, female) as percent of (total, male, female) secondary enrollment. Vocational and Technical education is defined as education mainly designed to lead participants to acquire the practical skills, know-how and understanding necessary for employment in a particular occupation or trade (or class of occupations or trades). Successful completion of such programmes normally leads to a labour-market relevant vocational qualification recognized by the competent authorities (e.g. Ministry of Education, employers associations, etc.) in the country in which it is obtained.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Secondary education, pupils (% female)
sourceNote: Female pupils as a percentage of total pupils at secondary level includes enrollments in public and private schools.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Secondary education, general pupils
sourceNote: Secondary general pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in general education programs, including teacher training.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Secondary education, general pupils (% female)
sourceNote: Secondary general pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in general education programs, including teacher training.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Vocational and Technical enrollment (% of total secondary enrollment), male
sourceNote: Vocational and Technical enrollment (% of total secondary enrollment) is the number of vocational and technical secondary level students (total, male, female) as percent of (total, male, female) secondary enrollment. Vocational and Technical education is defined as education mainly designed to lead participants to acquire the practical skills, know-how and understanding necessary for employment in a particular occupation or trade (or class of occupations or trades). Successful completion of such programmes normally leads to a labour-market relevant vocational qualification recognized by the competent authorities (e.g. Ministry of Education, employers associations, etc.) in the country in which it is obtained.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Pupil-teacher ratio, secondary
sourceNote: Secondary school pupil-teacher ratio is the number of pupils enrolled in secondary school divided by the number of secondary school teachers (regardless of their teaching assignment).
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

name: Secondary education, vocational pupils
sourceNote: Secondary vocational pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in technical and vocational education programs, including teacher training.

name: Secondary education, vocational pupils (% female)
sourceNote: Secondary vocational pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in technical and vocational education programs, including teacher training.

name: Vocational and Technical enrollment (% of total secondary enrollment), total
sourceNote: Vocational and technical enrollment in secondary education is the percentage of secondary students enrolled in vocational education programs including teacher training, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students who are enrolled in secondary education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: School enrollment, secondary (% gross)
sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.
sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

sourceNote: Net enrollment ratio is the ratio of children of official school age based on the International Standard Classification of Education 1997 who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age.
